channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Multiple pot holes and road sinking, 13th August
item.description:
Outside old bakery

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 60, School Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeds growing out of road gully, 13th August
item.description:
Adjacent to entrance to 64 Lansdown Road. Gully has weeds growing out of it - presumably therefore full of silt. Clearly hasn't been cleaned out in years. Was told in February that gullies along this stretch of the A40 were to be cleaned "before the end of the financial year", so by early April. Hasn't happened.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Lansdown Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No street lighting, 13th August
item.description:
Outside 3/5 wymans road making junction dangerous
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Wyman's Road, Whaddon, Cheltenham

item.title: New tree dying, 13th August
item.description:
Very thirsty. May not survive. SR CBC
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Windyridge Road, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree sprouting from bottom obscuring view of road, 13th August
item.description:
The tree outside 204 Cheltenham Road, Longlevens GL2 0JW is sprouting from the base and the foliage has got very thick. When exiting the drive of 204 Cheltenham Road it is impossible to see safely traffic coming from the left so after a couple of near misses we would be grateful if the foliage could be cut away from the tree, to make exiting the drive safe. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wishford Close, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement tarmac cracking, 13th August
item.description:
The path between Little Walk and Mandeville Close. Multiple cracks, with the heat over last few weeks some are becoming quite large and may cause an elderly person with a walking aid to fall. This is outside OAP bungalows, all use sticks and 1 is visually impaired

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mandeville Close, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Barrier was broken due to car going into it., 13th August
item.description:
The barrier has been broken due to a car driving into it. It is outside the rear of Duckstone house. This presents a difficulty for pedestrians. Last week there was sewerage running down the other access point and pedestrians had to walk on the road. Issue has been present for almost 7 weeks. Repairs needed ASAP.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Road, Stoke Orchard, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 13th August
item.description:
Customer reporting that basal growth around the bottom of the trees at this location is obstructing visibility of traffic for peaople nearer ground level (children, mobility scooter users, etc) Customer states they nearly got hit by a car when crossing the road as they couldn't be seen
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drainage/Pothole 🕳️ Developing, 13th August
item.description:
A resident has reported the following to me. Has anyone else noticed the potential new problem/culvert on New road? If driving in towards Woodmancote then it is level with the triangular horse sign on the other side of the road... If sorted soon may prevent similar closures to last time.?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gambles Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are dead branches in the trees along the whole of Sydenham Road North, the trees are also incredibly high and have not been pollarded in years! We are concerned that a branch will break off and fall into our driveway damaging our vehicles, 13th August
